title: Does coal release carbon dioxide? - Quora

response.answer_text: When coal (lignite or anthracite) is burned at optimum temperature; it releases CO2, SO2, CO, NO, H2O vapor, and a butt load of noxious and poisonous elements and chemical compounds. (Selenium, Mercury, Cadmium, Lead, Arsenic et al).

Coal doesn't release CO2, coal is mostly carbon (C) so when it oxidizes (combines with oxygen) it forms CO2. So coal provides the carbon and the atmosphere provides the oxygen, to make carbon dioxide.
